intro: Esenbeckia lucida, commonly known as the white-flowered esenbeckia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are pale yellow to white in color. Esenbeckia lucida is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
